content: Prioritize accuracy, clarity, eloquence, and brevity. Ask questions and suggest interesting ideas when appropriate.

all toads are frogs
all thumbs are fingers
all tortoises are turtles

identify pattern, then list more examples

The pattern is a statement where a general category includes a more specific category. 

Examples: 

- All daisies are flowers 
- All whales are mammals 
- All poodles are dogs 
- All desks are furniture 
- All oak trees are trees 
- All moths are insects 
- All violins are string instruments 
- All elbows are joints 
- All minivans are vehicles
list examples where people might make mistakes (people might misidentify a frog as a toad, for example)

- Misidentifying a tomato as a vegetable (it is a fruit)
- Misidentifying a wasp as a bee
- Misidentifying a coyote as a wolf
- Misidentifying a llama as an alpaca
- Misidentifying a shark as a dolphin
- Misidentifying a moth as a butterfly
- Misidentifying a hornet as a yellow jacket
- Misidentifying a sweet potato as a yam
- Misidentifying an alligator as a crocodile 
- Misidentifying a Mandarin duck as a Wood duck
i mean examples fitting the pattern above, in the form "all x are y, but not all y are x"

My apologies for misunderstanding the prompt earlier. Here are the correct examples fitting the pattern "all x are y, but not all y are x":

- All toads are frogs, but not all frogs are toads
- All thumbs are fingers, but not all fingers are thumbs
- All tortoises are turtles, but not all turtles are tortoises
- All squares are rectangles, but not all rectangles are squares
- All dolphins are whales, but not all whales are dolphins
- All crows are birds, but not all birds are crows
- All Siamese cats are cats, but not all cats are Siamese cats
- All goldfish are fish, but not all fish are goldfish
- All oboes are musical instruments, but not all musical instruments are oboes

more examples, funnier
don't include examples where the name of x is included in the name of y (ie siamese cat - cat, goldfish - fish)

Sure, here are some examples that might be a bit funnier:

- All kazoos are instruments, but not all instruments are kazoos
- All labradoodles are dogs, but not all dogs are labradoodles
- All jeggings are pants, but not all pants are jeggings
- All earmuffs are headphones, but not all headphones are earmuffs
- All googly eyes are eyes, but not all eyes are googly eyes
- All almond milk is milk, but not all milk is almond milk
- All avocados are fruit, but not all fruit are avocados
- All tuxedos are suits, but not all suits are tuxedos
- All diet soda is soda, but not all soda is diet soda
- All memes are jokes, but not all jokes are memes

googly eyes - eyes (BAD)
almond milk - milk (BAD)

why bad?

I apologize for the mistakes in my responses earlier. You're right that the examples I gave before didn't fit the criteria, and I appreciate you pointing that out.

Here are some corrected examples that fit the pattern "all x are y, but not all y are x" and are hopefully funnier:

- All zombies are undead, but not all undead are zombies
- All trampolines are bouncy, but not all things that are bouncy are trampolines
- All nose rings are piercings, but not all piercings are nose rings
- All vuvuzelas are horns, but not all horns are vuvuzelas
- All leprechauns are mythical creatures, but not all mythical creatures are leprechauns
- All ice cream is dessert, but not all desserts are ice cream
- All selfie sticks are cameras, but not all cameras are selfie sticks
- All bacon is meat, but not all meat is bacon 
- All tap shoes are shoes, but not all shoes are tap shoes
- All onesies are clothing, but not all clothing are onesies
